title: Denmark Bay
text:
Denmark Bay is an <a href="Arctic">Arctic</a> waterway in <a href="Kitikmeot%20Region%2C%20Nunavut">Kitikmeot Region</a>, <a href="Nunavut">Nunavut</a>, Canada. It is located in western <a href="M%27Clintock%20Channel">M'Clintock Channel</a>, off the eastern coast of <a href="Victoria%20Island%20%28Canada%29">Victoria Island</a>. It is separated from <a href="Homan%20Bay">Homan Bay</a> by a peninsula with a narrow <a href="isthmus">isthmus</a>.
Geography.
There are several islands within the bay, including <a href="Falsen%20Island">Falsen Island</a> at its headwaters.
<a href="Moraine">Moraine</a> ridges are found along eastern Victoria Island from Denmark Bay to Greely Haven.
History.
The <a href="Ekalluktogmiut">Ekalluktogmiut</a>, a subgroup of <a href="Copper%20Inuit">Copper Inuit</a>, were traditionally located from Denmark Bay through <a href="Dease%20Strait">Dease Strait</a>. However, Copper Inuit traditional hunting area was south of the Denmark Bay/Walker Bay region.
